source_text: *Suicide, my ass*, was my instant, and silent, reaction. Why hadn't Sybil hired me to come out here to read his grave first, instead of sending me to the woods to find Teenie? Of course this boy hadn't shot himself. Dell Teague had been murdered, just like his wild girlfriend. I opened my eyes. Hollis Boxleitner had swung around to check on what I was doing. I looked into the intent face of the deputy. "No suicide here," I said.
translation_attempt: *Bunuh diri, omong kosong*, reaksi instan dan terdiam saya. Mengapa Sybil tidak mempekerjakan saya untuk datang ke sini untuk melihat makamnya terlebih dahulu, alih-alih mengirim saya ke hutan untuk mencari Teenie? Tentu saja anak ini tidak bunuh diri. Dell Teague dibunuh, sama seperti pacar gila mereka. Saya membuka mata. Hollis Boxleitner berbalik untuk melihat apa yang sedang saya lakukan. Saya menatap wajah serius seorang wakil. "Tidak ada bunuh diri di sini," kataku.
rubric:
semantic_accuracy: True
tonal_fidelity: True
natural_fluency: True
nuance_preservation: False
feedback: While the translation demonstrates a generally acceptable level of semantic accuracy and natural fluency, it unfortunately fails to preserve the nuance of the original text, specifically regarding the informal and somewhat cynical tone. The phrase "Suicide, my ass" is effectively translated as "Bunuh diri, omong kosong," which captures the core meaning. However, the Indonesian translation lacks the same level of dismissive, almost sarcastic, attitude present in the English. "Omong kosong" is a fairly neutral term for "nonsense" and doesn't carry the same bite or implied disbelief as the English idiom. Furthermore, the phrase "intent face of the deputy" is a literal translation and sounds slightly unnatural in Indonesian. While understandable, it doesn't flow as smoothly as it could. A more idiomatic translation would be preferable. The failure to capture this subtle nuance significantly impacts the overall quality of the translation. While the core meaning is conveyed, the translation lacks the characteristic voice and attitude of the original, making it feel somewhat flat and less engaging. Therefore, the translation requires revision to better reflect the original's tone and implied meaning.

source_text: *Suicide, my ass*, was my instant, and silent, reaction. Why hadn't Sybil hired me to come out here to read his grave first, instead of sending me to the woods to find Teenie? Of course this boy hadn't shot himself. Dell Teague had been murdered, just like his wild girlfriend. I opened my eyes. Hollis Boxleitner had swung around to check on what I was doing. I looked into the intent face of the deputy. "No suicide here," I said.
translation_attempt: *Bunuh diri, masa bodoh*, itu reaksi instan dan sunyi saya. Kenapa Sybil tidak mempekerjakan saya untuk mengunjungi makamnya terlebih dahulu, alih-alih mengirim saya ke hutan mencari Teenie? Tentu saja anak ini tidak bunuh diri. Dell Teague dibunuh, sama seperti pacar gilanya. Saya membuka mata. Hollis Boxleitner berputar untuk memeriksa apa yang saya lakukan. Saya menatap wajah serius wakil sheriff itu. "Tidak ada bunuh diri di sini," ujarku.
rubric:
semantic_accuracy: True
tonal_fidelity: False
natural_fluency: True
nuance_preservation: False
feedback:
While the translation demonstrates reasonable semantic accuracy – the core meaning of the text is conveyed – it unfortunately fails on several crucial fronts. The tone is a significant issue. "Bunuh diri, masa bodoh" translates "Suicide, my ass" literally, but the Indonesian phrasing lacks the sarcastic, cynical, and dismissive tone of the original. "Masa bodoh" implies indifference or a lack of concern, which isn't quite the same as the original's contemptuous rejection of the idea of suicide. This tonal mismatch significantly weakens the impact of the opening line. 

Furthermore, the translation misses the nuance of the phrase "wild girlfriend." "Pacar gila" is a very literal translation of "crazy girlfriend," which doesn't capture the implied rebellious or unconventional nature of the relationship. This lack of nuance diminishes the overall richness of the text. 

The fluency is acceptable, though a more natural phrasing could be achieved. However, the tonal and nuance failures are critical. A successful translation must not only convey the literal meaning but also replicate the author's voice and the subtle complexities of the original. Therefore, this translation requires significant revision to better capture the intended tone and nuances of the source text. It needs to be more evocative and less literal to truly resonate with an Indonesian-speaking audience.

Tentu saja anak ini tidak bunuh diri. Dell Teague dibunuh, sama seperti pacar bengalnya. Saya membuka mata. Hollis Boxleitner telah berbalik untuk melihat apa yang saya lakukan. feedback: While the translation demonstrates a generally good understanding of the source text's meaning (Semantic Accuracy - PASS) and maintains a similar tone (Tonal Fidelity - PASS), it unfortunately fails to capture the nuance of the original. The phrase "Bunuh diri? Omong kosong," while conveying the sentiment of disbelief, is a bit too direct and lacks the subtle cynicism and dismissive attitude present in the original "Suicide, my ass." The Indonesian translation is grammatically correct and reads relatively naturally (Natural Fluency - PASS), but the choice of words doesn't quite replicate the original's sarcastic and slightly vulgar tone. More importantly, the translation misses the subtle implication of the original's phrasing. The original uses "my ass" as a very informal and emphatic way of expressing disbelief. The Indonesian translation, while conveying disbelief, lacks this same level of informal, almost defiant, dismissal. The phrase "Omong kosong" is a common expression for "nonsense" or "rubbish," but it doesn't carry the same weight of personal, almost aggressive, rejection of the idea as the original. The failure to preserve this subtle nuance is significant enough to warrant a "needs_revision" grade. A more effective translation would explore alternative phrasing that captures the original's sarcastic and dismissive tone without resorting to overly literal translations. For example, something closer to "Suicide? Please." or "Suicide? Don't be ridiculous." might better convey the intended meaning and attitude.

The phrase "Bunuh diri? Omong kosong" (Suicide? Nonsense) is a direct translation and lacks the impactful, almost sarcastic, tone of "Suicide, my ass." The original English phrase carries a strong sense of disbelief and disdain, which is diminished in the Indonesian translation. The use of "pikiranku langsung berteriak dalam hati" (my thoughts immediately screamed in my heart) is a bit too literal and doesn't quite capture the internal, almost muttered, quality of the original. The phrase "wajah serius wakil polisi itu" (the serious face of the deputy police) is grammatically correct but lacks the subtle implication of the deputy's intent gaze conveyed by "intent face." Therefore, although the translation is understandable and doesn't contain egregious errors, the failure to capture the original's tone and subtle implications necessitates a revision to achieve the required level of quality. The translation needs to be more idiomatic and consider the cultural context to better reflect the original's voice and attitude.

source_text: *Suicide, my ass*, was my instant, and silent, reaction. Why hadn't Sybil hired me to come out here to read his grave first, instead of sending me to the woods to find Teenie? Of course this boy hadn't shot himself. Dell Teague had been murdered, just like his wild girlfriend. I opened my eyes. Hollis Boxleitner had swung around to check on what I was doing. I looked into the intent face of the deputy. "No suicide here," I said.
translation_attempt: *Bunuh diri? Jangan bodoh,* adalah reaksi pertamaku, yang terdiam. Kenapa Sybil tidak mempekerjakanku untuk melihat makamnya dulu, daripada mengirimku ke hutan mencari Teenie? Tentu saja anak ini tidak bunuh diri. Dell Teague dibunuh, sama seperti pacar playboy-nya. Aku membuka mata. Hollis Boxleitner berbalik melihat apa yang kulakukan. Aku menatap wajah serius wakil polisi itu. "Bukan bunuh diri," kataku.

semantic_accuracy: True
tonal_fidelity: True
natural_fluency: True

feedback: While the translation demonstrates a generally acceptable level of fluency and accurately conveys the core meaning of the source text, it unfortunately fails to preserve the nuance of the original. The phrase "Bunuh diri? Jangan bodoh" (Suicide? Don't be foolish) is a direct translation and lacks the sarcastic, dismissive tone of "Suicide, my ass." The original uses a very informal and almost vulgar expression, which is lost in the Indonesian translation. The use of "playboy" to describe the girlfriend is also a somewhat literal translation and doesn't quite capture the implied judgment or perhaps even a hint of disdain present in the original. The overall effect is a translation that is grammatically correct and understandable, but lacks the sharp, cynical edge of the source text. This failure to preserve the intended tone and subtle implications necessitates a revision to better reflect the original's voice and character. Therefore, the final grade is `needs_revision`.

source_text: I don't like being treated like a confidence trickster, and I'm sure Tolliver likes it even less. I retreat inside myself, and I don't let them touch my quick. Tolliver tries to do that, too, but he is less successful. He gets very upset when people impugn our honor.
translation_attempt: Aku tidak suka diperlakukan seperti penipu ulung, dan aku yakin Tolliver bahkan lebih membencinya. Aku menarik diri ke dalam diriku sendiri, dan tidak membiarkan mereka menyentuh kesadaranku. Tolliver mencoba melakukan itu juga, tetapi dia kurang berhasil. Dia sangat kesal ketika orang mencoreng kehormatan kita.

The phrase "touch my quick" is a slang term implying a feeling of being taken advantage of or having one's vulnerabilities exploited. The Indonesian translation, "menyentuh kepalaku" (touch my head), is too literal and lacks the idiomatic punch of the original. It doesn't convey the same sense of being deeply manipulated or having one's essence violated. Furthermore, "mencoreng kehormatan kami" (blemish our honor) is a somewhat formal and stiff translation of "impugn our honor." While grammatically correct, it doesn't capture the slightly more aggressive and indignant tone of the original. The overall effect is a translation that is understandable but lacks the subtle sharpness and emotional weight present in the source text. source_text:
"Tell me about your dream house," Hollis said, smiling.

"Okay," I said, slowly. This was something I didn't talk about too often. "It will have to be off the beaten road, of course. I want it to look like a log cabin, but without the inconveniences of a real log cabin. I found a plan on the Internet, and I bought it. But of course, I want to alter it a little."

"Of course," he said, taking a sip of beer. "

It would be two bedrooms and a study, with a family room. There'd be a kitchen here, with the washroom right off of it." I was looking down at the table, drawing with my finger. "Around back, there'd be a *porte cochere* for the cars, so you could carry groceries right into the kitchen without getting wet. There's a deck off the right side of the kitchen, see? Or maybe I'd put it off the family room. That's where the fireplace will be, and you could keep your firewood on the deck. And you could put your gas grill on the deck. For steaks."
translation_attempt:
"Ceritakan tentang rumah impianmu," kata Hollis sambil tersenyum.

"Baiklah," jawabku, perlahan. Ini adalah sesuatu yang jarang sekali aku bicarakan. "Tentu saja, rumah itu harus jauh dari keramaian. Aku ingin tampilannya seperti pondok kayu, tetapi tanpa ketidaknyamanan pondok kayu sungguhan. Aku menemukan gambaran rencananya di Internet, dan aku membelinya. Tapi tentu saja, aku ingin mengubahnya sedikit."

"Tentu," katanya, sambil mengicipi bir.

Akan ada dua kamar tidur dan sebuah ruang kerja, dengan ruang keluarga. Akan ada dapur di sini, dengan kamar mandi tepat di sampingnya. Aku menunduk melihat meja, menggambar dengan jariku. "Di belakang, akan ada *porte cochere* untuk mobil, jadi kamu bisa membawa belanjaan langsung ke dapur tanpa basah. Ada teras di sisi kanan dapur, lihat? Atau mungkin aku akan menempatkannya di samping ruang keluarga. Di sanalah perapian akan berada, dan kamu bisa menyimpan kayu bakar di teras. Dan kamu bisa meletakkan pemanggang gas di teras. Untuk steak."
rubric:
semantic_accuracy: True
tonal_fidelity: True
natural_fluency: True
nuance_preservation: True
feedback: The translation is remarkably well done. All four criteria are met with a "PASS." The semantic accuracy is excellent; the meaning of the original text is faithfully conveyed. The tone is maintained effectively, preserving the casual and conversational nature of the dialogue. The Indonesian reads naturally, avoiding any awkward phrasing or grammatical errors. Crucially, the use of "*porte cochere*" is preserved, which is a good example of nuance preservation. While a direct Indonesian equivalent might exist, retaining the French term adds a touch of sophistication and accurately reflects the speaker's vocabulary. The translation successfully captures the overall feeling and intent of the original excerpt. There are no significant improvements needed.

feedback: While the translation demonstrates a generally accurate conveyance of the text's meaning (Semantic Accuracy: PASS) and maintains a suitable tone (Tonal Fidelity: PASS), it unfortunately fails to achieve natural fluency and effectively preserve nuance. The Indonesian translation reads somewhat clunky and unnatural. Phrases like "di sampingnya" (beside it) and "tepat di sampingnya" (right beside it) are grammatically correct but sound awkward in this context. The use of "akan ada" (there will be) repeatedly also contributes to a less fluid reading experience. More significantly, the translation fails to adequately preserve the nuance of the word "*porte cochere*." While the literal translation is provided, the phrase lacks the elegance and sophistication of the original. A more idiomatic translation that captures the concept of a covered driveway without being overly literal would be preferable. The translation also lacks a certain stylistic flair that would make it read more naturally and engagingly. The overall effect is a translation that is understandable but lacks the polish and sophistication expected of a high-quality literary translation. Therefore, the translation requires revision to improve its fluency and nuance preservation.

Tapi tentu saja, aku ingin mengubahnya sedikit."

"Tentu," katanya, sambil meneguk bir.

Akan ada dua kamar tidur dan ruang kerja, dengan ruang keluarga. Akan ada dapur di sini, dengan kamar mandi tepat di sampingnya. Aku menunduk melihat meja, menggambar dengan jariku. "Di bagian belakang, akan ada *porte cochere* untuk mobil, jadi kamu bisa membawa belanjaan langsung ke dapur tanpa basah. Ada teras di sisi kanan dapur, lihat? Atau mungkin aku akan menempatkannya di samping ruang keluarga. Di sanalah perapian akan berada, dan kamu bisa menyimpan kayu bakar di teras. Dan kamu bisa menempatkan pemanggang gas di teras. Untuk steak."

feedback: The translation is remarkably well done. All four criteria are met with a "PASS." The semantic accuracy is excellent; the meaning of the original text is faithfully conveyed. The tone is maintained effectively, preserving the casual and conversational style of the English excerpt. The Indonesian reads naturally, avoiding any awkward phrasing or grammatical errors. Crucially, the use of "*porte cochere*" is preserved, demonstrating an understanding of the nuance and a willingness to retain a slightly more sophisticated term rather than opting for a simpler, less precise translation. The translation successfully captures the overall feeling and intent of the original passage. While a more experienced translator might explore slightly more idiomatic phrasing in a few places, the current translation is perfectly acceptable and demonstrates a high level of skill. There are no significant issues that would warrant a "needs_revision" designation.
